result.title: How do java competitive programmers use intellij?
result.content: Since we need to create solutions for each problem in a short amount of time so I don't think that creating separate projects for each one of them would a wise choice(Time consuming).Further if we create a package then within that we can have only one class with main,so in order to write multiple programs one will have to make readjustments to the previously written code(I used to do this,but it is highly inefficient) like changing the name of main function to something else and then again write new class with a separate main method.One more problem which I encountered was with the use of InputReader class for fastIO in java,that is after using it in one of the problem's solution(declared both the solution and the InputReader classes in the same ".java" file,so that the whole thing can be copied and pasted as the solution in the judge) the IDE did not allow to use the same class(InputReader) code in another file of the same project(Hence again readjustments).So my question how do competitive programmers who use java, use IntelliJ(The most used IDE for competitive coding in java) to produce faster solutions taking into account the above mentioned problems.
